00032 // Types for the expr parser.
00033 //
00034 // 11/4/95 jhrg
00035 
00036 #ifndef _expr_h
00037 #define _expr_h
00038 
00039 #include <string>
00040 #include <vector>
00041 
00042 #ifndef _basetype_h
00043 #include "BaseType.h"
00044 #endif
00045 
00046 // VALUE is used to return constant values from the scanner to the parser.
00047 // Constants are packaged in BaseType *s for evaluation by the parser.
00048 
00049 typedef struct {
00050     Type type;          // Type is an enum defined in BaseType.h
00051     union {
00052     unsigned int ui;
00053     int i;
00054     double f;
00055     string *s;
00056     } v;
00057 } value;
00058 
00059 // Syntactic sugar for `pointer to function returning boolean' (bool_func)
00060 // and `pointer to function returning BaseType *' (btp_func). Both function
00061 // types take three arguments, an integer (argc), a vector of BaseType *s
00062 // (argv) and the DDS for the dataset for which these function is being
00063 // evaluated (analogous to the ENVP in UNIX). ARGC is the length of ARGV.
00064 
00065 // Try to make a single `selection function' type.
00066 
00067 typedef bool (*bool_func)(int argc, BaseType *argv[], DDS &dds);
00068 typedef BaseType *(*btp_func)(int argc, BaseType *argv[], DDS &dds);
00069 typedef void (*proj_func)(int argc, BaseType *argv[], DDS &dds);
00070 
00071 // INT_LIST and INT_LIST_LIST are used by the parser to store the array
00072 // indices.
00073 
00074 typedef std::vector<int> int_list;
00075 typedef std::vector<int>::const_iterator int_citer ;
00076 typedef std::vector<int>::iterator int_iter ;
00077 typedef std::vector<int_list *> int_list_list;
00078 typedef std::vector<int_list *>::const_iterator int_list_citer ;
00079 typedef std::vector<int_list *>::iterator int_list_iter ;
00080
